entities.name: Fuels & Energy Infrastructure
entities.description: Decarbonising aviation depends not only on novel propulsion systems but on the ecosystems that fuel them. This focus area builds on strong DfT momentum around Sustainable Aviation Fuels (SAF), supporting the scale-up of supply, infrastructure, and adoption. Looking ahead, innovation in hydrogen-powered flight will require advances in aircraft design and the development of supporting infrastructure for hydrogen generation, distribution, and on-site storage. Electrification is another key pathway, particularly for smaller aviation platforms like drones, where battery technology and lightweight systems are evolving rapidly.
entities.embedding_text: Aviation Fuels & Energy Infrastructure: Decarbonising aviation through Sustainable Aviation Fuels SAF, hydrogen-powered flight, electrification for drones and smaller platforms. Supporting scale-up of supply, infrastructure, and adoption. Key technologies include hydrogen generation distribution storage, battery systems, and potentially micro nuclear. Addresses high capital costs and infrastructure gaps in aviation decarbonisation.

entities.name: End-of-Life Airframes & E-Waste
entities.description: The retirement of aircraft presents a significant opportunity to reduce embodied emissions by extending the useful life of high-value materials and components. Airframes are large, material-intensive structures that have undergone substantial processing and global supply chain input. By developing circular supply chains and exploring downstream applications, we can offset the need for new extraction, processing, and manufacturing, unlocking both carbon savings and economic value.
entities.embedding_text: Aviation End-of-Life Airframes & E-Waste: Circular economy for aircraft retirement, extending useful life of high-value materials and components. Developing circular supply chains, downstream applications for airframe materials. Reducing embodied emissions through materials recycling and component reuse. Addresses limited recycling infrastructure and economic viability challenges.

entities.name: Advanced Air Mobility (AAM)
entities.description: Advanced Air Mobility encompasses the integration of new aerial platforms into urban and regional transport systems. This includes electric vertical take-off and landing vehicles (eVTOLs), urban air mobility (UAM), regional air mobility (RAM), and uncrewed aircraft systems (drones). The focus area addresses vertiport development, airspace integration, and the regulatory frameworks needed to enable safe commercial operations.
entities.embedding_text: Aviation Advanced Air Mobility AAM: eVTOLs electric vertical take-off landing, urban air mobility UAM, regional air mobility RAM, drones uncrewed aircraft. Vertiport development, airspace integration, UTM uncrewed traffic management. Regulatory frameworks for safe commercial operations. Addresses regulatory uncertainty, public acceptance, infrastructure investment barriers.

entities.name: Passenger Experience
entities.description: This focus area addresses the full spectrum of inclusive transport, from accessibility for disabled and injured users to neurodiversity, age, and pregnancy to ensure that innovation supports all users, not just the average passenger. The work spans social research, behavioural insight, and co-design to inform adoption of both emerging and existing solutions. Where emerging technologies are relevant, the focus includes advanced wearables, biotech interfaces, smart sensors, and immersive technologies like AR, VR, and holographic media.
entities.embedding_text: Aviation Passenger Experience: Inclusive transport for disabled users, neurodiversity, age, pregnancy. Social research, behavioural insight, co-design. Technologies include AR VR augmented virtual reality, wearables, smart sensors, biotech interfaces. Human-centred approach ensuring equitable, intuitive, trusted transport systems for all users.

entities.name: Airport Operations
entities.description: Airport Operations builds on CPC's established research base, including a dynamic 3D model of Glasgow Airport and deep insight into passenger and operational journeys. This focus area supports innovation across the full airport ecosystem from automation in luggage handling and refuelling to advanced facilities management and operational coordination. It includes workforce development as a core pillar, focusing on skills, cross-skilling, workforce attraction, and retention, especially as automation reshapes operational roles.
entities.embedding_text: Aviation Airport Operations: Automation in luggage handling, refuelling, facilities management. Digital twins, Glasgow Airport 3D model. Workforce development, skills, cross-skilling as automation reshapes roles. AR augmented reality for staff. Security including cyber and counter-drone. Airport as testbed for future-ready infrastructure.

entities.name: Public Impact & Perception
entities.description: This focus area addresses how aviation affects communities and how perceptions of those effects shape the future of flight. Public resistance to noise and air pollution is one of the most significant barriers to the development and expansion of aerial platforms, whether legacy aircraft or emerging technologies like drones and eVTOLs. This work explores sound mitigation strategies including soundproofing, frequency balancing, and quieter propulsion.
entities.embedding_text: Aviation Public Impact & Perception: Community relations, noise and air pollution concerns. Sound mitigation, soundproofing, frequency balancing, quieter propulsion. Public acceptance of drones and eVTOLs. Smart routing, noise zoning. Addressing public resistance as barrier to aerial platform expansion.

entities.name: Propulsion & Ship Decarbonisation
entities.description: Maritime decarbonisation requires fundamental changes to ship propulsion systems. This focus area addresses the transition from conventional fuels to alternative propulsion including hydrogen, ammonia, methanol, and electrification for short-sea shipping. It encompasses fuel infrastructure development, vessel retrofitting, and new-build specifications.
entities.embedding_text: Maritime Propulsion & Ship Decarbonisation: Alternative propulsion hydrogen ammonia methanol electrification. Fuel infrastructure development, vessel retrofitting, new-build specifications. Short-sea shipping electrification. Fuel cells and alternative fuels for maritime. Addresses fuel availability, infrastructure costs, technology maturity barriers.

entities.name: Shipyard & Port Operations
entities.description: Modernising UK shipyards and port operations through digital technologies, automation, and improved logistics. This includes port infrastructure upgrades, supply chain optimisation, and workforce development for the maritime sector.
entities.embedding_text: Maritime Shipyard & Port Operations: Modernising UK shipyards and ports through digital technologies, automation, improved logistics. Port infrastructure upgrades, supply chain optimisation. Smart berths, predictive maintenance. Workforce development for maritime sector. Addresses legacy infrastructure and investment cycle barriers.

entities.name: Electric and Autonomous Freight Connection
entities.description: Connecting maritime freight with inland electric and autonomous logistics networks. This focus area addresses the first/last mile challenge for ports and the integration of autonomous vessels with shore-side autonomous systems.
entities.embedding_text: Maritime Electric and Autonomous Freight Connection: Connecting maritime freight with inland electric autonomous logistics. First/last mile challenge for ports. Autonomous vessels integrated with shore-side autonomous systems. Electric trucks, automated container handling, intermodal systems. Addresses regulatory frameworks and technology integration barriers.

entities.name: Autonomy of Ports, Ships and Sheds
entities.description: Developing autonomous and semi-autonomous operations across the maritime sector, from autonomous vessels to automated port operations and warehouse facilities. Includes the Centre of Autonomy concept for the South West.
related_projects: TCE - South West Maritime Autonomy Centre
entities.embedding_text: Maritime Autonomy of Ports Ships and Sheds: Autonomous semi-autonomous operations across maritime. Autonomous vessels, automated port operations, warehouse automation. Centre of Autonomy South West concept. AI ML for operations, remote operation centres. Crown Estate partnership. Addresses regulatory approval, safety assurance, public trust barriers.

entities.name: Safety & Security
entities.description: Maritime safety and security including cyber security, physical security of critical infrastructure, and protection of subsea assets. Includes geofencing and monitoring systems for critical maritime infrastructure.
related_projects: Geofencing critical maritime infrastructure (sea and subsea)
entities.embedding_text: Maritime Safety & Security: Cyber security, physical security of critical infrastructure, subsea asset protection. Geofencing and monitoring systems for critical maritime infrastructure. AI surveillance, threat detection. MOD partnership opportunity. Addresses evolving threat landscape and skills gaps.

entities.name: Next Generation Workforce
entities.description: Addressing the maritime sector's workforce challenges including skills development, attraction of new talent, and transition support as automation changes job roles. Focus on future skills needs and training pathways.
entities.embedding_text: Maritime Next Generation Workforce: Skills development, talent attraction, transition support as automation changes roles. Future skills needs and training pathways. Simulation training, digital skills platforms, AR VR training. Addresses industry perception, training investment, skills recognition barriers.

entities.name: Electric Battery & Hydrogen Trains
entities.description: Decarbonising rail traction through battery-electric and hydrogen trains for non-electrified routes. Includes understanding barriers and enabling pathways for clean energy transition across rail operations.
entities.embedding_text: Rail Electric Battery & Hydrogen Trains: Decarbonising rail traction for non-electrified routes. Battery-electric trains, hydrogen trains, fuel cells, hybrid traction. Clean energy transition across rail operations. Network Rail, DfT partnerships. Addresses infrastructure investment and business case uncertainty barriers.

entities.name: Stations as Energy Hubs
entities.description: Reimagining railway stations as energy generation and distribution hubs, including renewable energy systems and alternative fuels. Developing digital twins for energy efficiency optimisation.

entities.embedding_text: Rail Stations as Energy Hubs: Railway stations as energy generation distribution hubs. Renewable energy systems, solar PV, energy storage, smart grids, EV charging. entities.name: Decarbonising Materials & Infrastructure Longevity
entities.description: Reducing embodied carbon in rail infrastructure through materials innovation and extending asset life through advanced maintenance and monitoring. Includes sustainable materials for track, structures, and stations.
entities.embedding_text: Rail Decarbonising Materials & Infrastructure Longevity: Reducing embodied carbon in rail infrastructure. Materials innovation, extending asset life through advanced maintenance monitoring. Low-carbon concrete, recycled materials, predictive maintenance. Sustainable materials for track, structures, stations. Addresses specification requirements and supply chain readiness barriers.

entities.name: Stations as Accessible Transport Hubs
entities.description: Enhancing the efficiency, safety, and inclusivity of transport hubs. Creating multimodal transport hubs that integrate seamlessly with other transport modes. Focus on passenger experience and accessibility.
entities.embedding_text: Rail Stations as Accessible Transport Hubs: Multimodal transport hubs integrating seamlessly with other modes. Passenger experience and accessibility focus. Wayfinding systems, accessibility tech, real-time information, seamless ticketing. Network Rail partnerships. Addresses legacy infrastructure and fragmented ownership barriers.

entities.name: Freight Innovation
entities.description: Improving rail freight efficiency and capacity, including modal shift from road to rail. Focus on logistics innovation, terminal operations, and integration with wider supply chains.
entities.embedding_text: Rail Freight Innovation: Improving rail freight efficiency and capacity. Modal shift from road to rail. Logistics innovation, terminal operations, supply chain integration. Automated terminals, longer trains, digital freight management, intermodal systems. Addresses path availability, terminal capacity, commercial incentive barriers.

entities.name: Intelligent Infrastructure & Climate Resilient System Integrity
entities.description: Collaborative development of AI and digital technologies to optimise operations, enhance safety, and build sector-wide innovation capability. Includes CReDO rail use case for climate resilience and infrastructure interdependency modelling.
entities.embedding_text: Rail Intelligent Infrastructure & Climate Resilient System Integrity: AI digital technologies to optimise operations, enhance safety. Addresses data availability, legacy systems, skills gaps barriers.

entities.name: Rail Innovation Zones
entities.description: Bridging the gap between technology development and operational deployment within rail's complex, safety-critical environment. Establishing and growing rail innovation zones as testbeds for new technologies.
entities.embedding_text: Rail Innovation Zones: Bridging technology development and operational deployment in safety-critical rail environment. Testbed facilities, simulation, controlled trial environments. SME access facilitation, testing protocols. Station Innovation Zone, Bristol Temple Meads. Addresses access to live environment and safety case requirement barriers.

entities.name: Convening Rail Innovation
entities.description: Building the UK rail innovation ecosystem through strategic coordination, capability development, and international positioning. Includes Rail Advisory Group and creation of procurement support products.
entities.embedding_text: Rail Convening Rail Innovation: Building UK rail innovation ecosystem through strategic coordination, capability development, international positioning. Rail Advisory Group, procurement support products. Ecosystem platforms, knowledge networks. Addresses fragmented ecosystem and procurement complexity barriers.

entities.name: Future Fuels & Electrification

entities.embedding_text: Highways Future Fuels & Electrification: Zero emission road transport, EV charging infrastructure, hydrogen for HGVs. Addressing £2.1bn revenue gap from declining fuel duty. entities.name: Decarbonising Road Infrastructure

entities.embedding_text: Highways Decarbonising Road Infrastructure: Reducing lifecycle emissions from road construction maintenance. Low-carbon asphalt, recycled materials, sustainable construction.
